entries.title: Labour won't spend its way out of Tory 'mess', says Sir Keir Starmer
entries.description: Sir Keir will promise "national renewal" but no "spending our way out of a crisis", in a major speech.

entries.title: Aston Villa 1-1 Wolverhampton Wanderers: Danny Ings denies Wolves in West Midlands derby
entries.description: Substitute Danny Ings' late equaliser earns Aston Villa a point and denies Wolves an important Premier League victory in their West Midlands derby at Villa Park.

entries.title: China Covid: EU officials 'strongly' urge testing for travel
entries.description: Travel in and out of China gets easier from Sunday, as it moves away from its zero-Covid strategy.

entries.title: Crystal Palace 0-4 Tottenham Hotspur: Harry Kane scores twice on 300th PL appearance
entries.description: Harry Kane scores two of Tottenham's four second-half goals after they eventually cruise to a Premier League win over Crystal Palace.

entries.title: Leeds United 2-2 West Ham United: Hammers remain in relegation trouble after Elland Road draw
entries.description: Rodrigo scores a fine 70th-minute equaliser for Leeds United to deny fourth-bottom West Ham United a much-needed win.

entries.title: NFL star's condition improving after cardiac arrest
entries.description: The American football player is still under intensive care after collapsing during a game on Monday.

entries.title: Gregg Berhalter: Giovanni Reyna's mother reported head coach to US Soccer
entries.description: The mother of United States midfielder Giovanni Reyna says she reported head coach Gregg Berhalter for kicking his wife when they were teenagers.

entries.title: Matt Hancock bids 'fond farewell' to his app after five years
entries.description: The former health secretary tells users they will still be able keep up with him on TikTok.

entries.title: German new year riots prompt calls for firework ban
entries.description: The mayor of Berlin plans a youth violence summit after police and firefighters come under attack.

entries.title: Makiivka attack: Could mobile phones have revealed Russian location?
entries.description: Russia says mobile phone signals gave their troops' position away before a Ukrainian attack.

entries.title: What does Rishi Sunak's promise to stop the boats mean?
entries.description: The issue of people crossing the English Channel in small boats was a key part of Rishi Sunak's speech.

entries.title: Cold medicine shortage blamed on lack of government planning
entries.description: Pharmacies say there are supply chain issues with some products but people should not panic buy.

entries.title: NHS Wales: Man carries grandad into hospital amid ambulance shortage
entries.description: There were no ambulances available to respond after an 83-year-old man collapsed.

entries.title: What does the US Speaker of the House do?
entries.description: Republican Kevin McCarthy is seeking to become Speaker, one of the most powerful roles in US politics.

entries.title: Rishi Sunak: Hold me to account if NHS waiting lists don't fall
entries.description: Rishi Sunak also makes pledges on the economy and small boat crossings in his first major speech of 2023.

entries.title: Pope Benedict had 'undeniable' presence on Francis, says archbishop
entries.description: Pope Francis has been working in his predecessor's shadow, says the Vatican's most senior British official.

entries.title: Birmingham doctor saves man's life on London to India flight
entries.description: Dr Vishwaraj Vemala was on a flight to India when a passenger went into cardiac arrest

entries.title: Man saved from being pulled under moving train in India
entries.description: A soldier from India's Railway Protection Force rescued a man who fell from a train.

entries.title: Taraneh Alidoosti: Iran releases top actress held for supporting protests
entries.description: Taraneh Alidoosti was arrested after she removed her headscarf and condemned recent executions.

entries.title: Pep Guardiola: Manchester City must be 'almost perfect' to catch Arsenal in Premier League
entries.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says his side will have to be "almost perfect" to catch leaders Arsenal in the Premier League title race.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Defying Russian onslaught in city 'at the end of the world'
entries.description: People in Bakhmut, at the epicentre of the war, live in defiance under constant Russian bombardment.

entries.title: China Covid: WHO warns about under-representing Covid deaths
entries.description: The health body says it is worried about the risk to life and again urges Beijing for better data.

entries.title: What is known about new Covid variant XBB.1.5?
entries.description: The latest Omicron variant is making scientists take notice in the US - so what do you need to know?

entries.title: Strike daily: How Thursday 5 January’s walkouts will affect you
entries.description: What you need to know about the rail strike and other industrial action this week, by the BBC's Zoe Conway.

entries.title: Colston Bassett: Man who stabbed ex to death jailed for life
entries.description: John Jessop, 26, murdered 47-year-old Clair Ablewhite shortly after their relationship ended.

entries.title: Rishi Sunak's five promises analysed
entries.description: Can the prime minister achieve his promises and is he taking a big political risk in making them?

entries.title: Fay Weldon obituary: Shrewd, mischievous and outspoken
entries.description: Witty and incisive novelist whose often colourful private life read like one of her own plots.

entries.title: Fay Weldon: The Life and Loves of a She-Devil author dies aged 91
entries.description: The author and essayist was best known for books including 1983's The Life and Loves of a She-Devil.

entries.title: Sainsbury's to raise pay to at least £11 per hour
entries.description: It marks the third time the supermarket giant has increased pay in the last year in a bid to keep up with rivals.

entries.title: Mark Cavendish robbery trial: Two suspects 'still at large'
entries.description: Two other men are accused of robbing the cyclist when he was at home in bed with his wife and son.

entries.title: Aled Davies: Body found in search for ex-BBC editor
entries.description: A body is discovered in the search for Aled Davies, who went missing on New Year's Eve.

entries.title: David Gold: West Ham United co-chairman dies following short illness
entries.description: West Ham United co-chairman David Gold dies at the age of 86 following a short illness.

entries.title: 'We've got a two-legged fox on the lawn'
entries.description: A family is stunned to find a fox with just two legs in their back garden.

entries.title: Bromley Council: Shaun Slator's rape comment sparks investigation
entries.description: Shaun Slator's comment has been described as "revolting" by Bromley's Labour group leader.

entries.title: Bethany England: Tottenham sign Chelsea forward on three-and-a-half year deal
entries.description: Tottenham Hotspur have signed forward Bethany England from Chelsea on a three-and-a-half year deal.

entries.title: Inquiry into eight deaths after NI ambulance delays
entries.description: The deaths of eight people in recent weeks may have been caused by lengthy ambulance waiting times.

entries.title: Novak Djokovic set to miss Indian Wells & Miami Open as US extends vaccine requirements
entries.description: Novak Djokovic is set to miss Indian Wells and the Miami Open as the US extends its requirement for international visitors to be vaccinated against Covid-19.

entries.title: Ronaldo mixes up South Africa and Saudi Arabia after Al Nassr move
entries.description: At his first press conference in Saudi Arabia, the football star refers to being in South Africa.

entries.title: Virgil van Dijk injury: Liverpool defender to see specialist about hamstring issue
entries.description: Liverpool centre-back Virgil van Dijk is to see a specialist to assess the extent of a hamstring injury.

entries.title: Mortgage approvals sink to lowest level in two years
entries.description: New figures from the Bank of England show that they dropped to their lowest level since the middle of the pandemic.

entries.title: Channel 4: Culture Secretary Michelle Donelan advises PM against privatisation
entries.description: In a leaked letter, the culture secretary tells the PM privatisation "is not the right decision".

entries.title: Warm winter may lower energy bills later this year
entries.description: Forecasts suggest bills for households may drop later in the year, although a rise in April remains certain.

entries.title: Jack Butland: Manchester United in talks to sign Crystal Palace goalkeeper
entries.description: Manchester United are in talks with Crystal Palace goalkeeper Jack Butland about a move to Old Trafford.

entries.title: Michael Smith: PDC world champion on being world number one & Catchphrase preparation
entries.description: New PDC world champion Michael Smith reflects on his title win and how TV quiz shows became a regular part in his preparation.

entries.title: Unclaimed bodies buried in Papua New Guinea mass grave
entries.description: The bodies were found decaying in an outdoor shed and almost half were children.

entries.title: Rishabh Pant accident: India wicketkeeper to be flown to Mumbai for surgery following car crash
entries.description: India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant will be flown to Mumbai by air ambulance to undergo surgery after being injured in a car crash last week.

entries.title: Amanda Serrano to fight Erika Cruz for undisputed featherweight crown on 4 February
entries.description: Amanda Serrano will face fellow featherweight champion Erika Cruz in an undisputed bout on 4 February in New York.

entries.title: Romeo and Juliet: Olivia Hussey and Leonard Whiting sue over 1968 film's 'sexual abuse'
entries.description: Leonard Whiting and Olivia Hussey were teenagers when they made the Oscar-winning 1968 movie.

entries.title: Juventus: 2023 begins with dark sky over Turin as financial & legal clouds gather
entries.description: If 2022 produced a series of disappointments for Juventus, who finished the season without a trophy for the first time in a decade, 2023 has the potential to be even worse.

entries.title: Australia helicopter collision: Father seeks prayers for 10-year-old fighting for life
entries.description: Simon Tadros' wife died in the accident and his 10-year-old son is in a critical condition.

entries.title: Colorado ex-funeral directors jailed for selling body parts
entries.description: A mother and her daughter dismembered hundreds of corpses, prosecutors in Colorado say.

entries.title: Sound Of 2023: Fred Again's emotive electronica earns second place
entries.description: Formerly a producer for Ed Sheeran and Stormzy, Fred Again's songs are rooted in human connection.

entries.title: Last surviving Apollo 7 astronaut Walter Cunningham dies at 90
entries.description: Walter Cunningham - described as a "true hero" - was on the first Nasa mission to broadcast live TV.

entries.title: British man Sean Patterson shot dead in Jamaica, police say
entries.description: Sean Patterson, a 33-year-old personal trainer, was shot and killed in St James, Jamaica.

entries.title: Harry Styles and Kate Bush among 2022's British best-sellers
entries.description: Harry Styles, Cat Burns and Kate Bush scored huge hits, as UK music fans streamed 150 billion songs.

entries.title: Tuesday to Thursday is the new office working week, data suggests
entries.description: Analysis of mobile phone data finds people are swapping big cities for life by the seaside.

entries.title: Ghana fishing: Abuse, corruption and death on Chinese vessels
entries.description: Ghanaian fishermen have told the BBC of widespread abuse on Chinese fishing vessels.

entries.title: NHS: Inside a GP surgery as winter pressure mounts
entries.description: This week surgeries across the country likely face intense demand after the Christmas break.

entries.title: Jeremy Renner: Avengers actor thanks fans after being run over by snow plough
entries.description: The Avengers star was run over by his own snow plough, the local sheriff said in a press conference.

entries.title: US House in chaos after Kevin McCarthy loses speaker votes
entries.description: Republican rebels defeated party leader Kevin McCarthy three times. Can he still find a way to win?

entries.title: Makiivka: Russia blames missile attack on troops' phone use
entries.description: Russia now says 89 soldiers were killed in the attack in Makiivka, in the occupied Donetsk region.

entries.title: Everton 1-4 Brighton: Can Frank Lampard survive latest defeat?
entries.description: After Tuesday's heavy defeat by Brighton, BBC Sport asks whether Frank Lampard can survive as Everton manager.

entries.title: The Papers: 'Must study maths until 18' as 'medics condemn PM'
entries.description: Most of Wednesday's papers report Rishi Sunak's pledge to make maths compulsory for under-18s.

entries.title: Shoppers face higher prices after energy bill help ends
entries.description: Shops may have no choice but to up prices when energy bills rise in April, the retail industry body says.
